result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick Bee Moua was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. 60 days to pay fine/costs or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts office. Cash bond applied.  Fine paid in full.
Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rick Bee Moua

9:30 AM Defendant Rick Bee Moua appeared by video.  Attorney Shawn Xiong Thao appeared by video for Rick Bee Moua.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement. Court finds defendant is appearing by zoom freely, knowingly and voluntarily.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to ct.1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea. Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of ct.1.  Count 2 dismissed but read in for sentencing. Victim makes statement. State/Defense join in sentencing recommendation, make statements.  Court makes statement, imposes sentence.  Bond no longer in effect.
Atty Thao Letter to Judge requesting plea/sentencing be scheduled.  Okay DLW.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 09:40 am.

10:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rick Bee Moua appeared by video.  Attorney Shawn Xiong Thao appeared by video for Rick Bee Moua. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defense waives formal reading of criminal complaint enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:40 am.
